She tried to lunge at Percy, only to go right through him, sending a bolt of electricity right through him as she did so.

“Hey!” Percy said, his hair standing on end. “Don't do that!”

“Why not?” She said, pouting. “I see the old blowhard having sex all the time. I want to experience it too!” She said, tone like a spoiled teenager. “And that stupid Trident won't even tell me his name!” She looked Percy up and down. “But you're not all that bad yourself.” She said with a sly grin. She floated back over to him. “What's your name, cutie?”

“Perseus, but everyone calls me Percy.” He said, avoiding her touch easily. “But, uh, aren't you concerned about having been... stolen? Kidnapped?” Percy asked. “Come to think of it, what do you call a weapon that has a soul if it's taken?”

“Stolen.” She said. “And no, I'm not concerned. I'm a weapon, and I'm only concerned whose wielding me at the moment. By the way, I'm Phosphora.”

“Nice to meet you.” Percy said. “And I can take it from the way you refer to Zeus that you're not fond of him?”

Phosphora lazily floated on her back, hands behind her head and legs crossed. “Psh, no. Doesn't acknowledge me for twenty thousand years, and doesn't even pay attention to my physical form until it's stolen. He didn't even polish me! A lightning bolt does not keep their shine for long!” She ranted.

“Well, I can't help but agree with you there. Zeus is an asshole.”

“But not as much as his son. Ugh, the nerve of him. Tampering with my home. I should fry him like a fish! No one messes with my home!”

Percy grinned. “Well, do I have a proposition for you then.”

Phosphora looked questioningly at Percy. “Oh? And what might that be cutie?”

“Why don't you help me Fight Ares when the time comes? And, to sweeten the deal, I can make sure that Zeus doesn't own you anymore. And, as an extra bonus, I should be able to give you a physical body.”

Phosphora grinned at him. “Oh yeah? Well, you are just too good to be true.” She said, trying to pinch his cheek. “I guess, as long as I get a real body. And as long as I get to fry that stupid war god.”

“Deal.” Percy said, holding out his hand.

Phosphora grinned, taking it, sending a large ZAP though Percy's hand. He yelped in pain, shaking his hand. “Oh, did it hurt? Want Phosphora to make it all better?” She asked, baby talking like a lovey-dovey girlfriend.

“Don't push it.” Percy grumbled. Damn, even with how powerful he was the master bolt wasn't something to take lightly.

Phosphora only giggled.

Percy appeared in his Room, Grover and Annabeth watching the news.

“Researchers are still unsure what could have caused the wide-scale damage outside of Athens, Greece, nor what could have caused all the trees in the olive orchard to grow to such heights so rapidly.” The reporter said.

“Oh, hey Percy.” Grover said, munching on a tin can. “You wouldn't have had anything to do with this, would you?”

“Yep.” Percy said, putting down Phosphora's 'home'. “Part of that family business I told you about. Kind of Melum's doing, but still on my behalf.”

“Uh huh.” Grover mumbled, finishing off his snack. “Anyway, have you seen Echidna?”

“Nope. I was busy the last few hours. Last minute planning and all that. I thought she was with you.”

Annabeth shook her head. “After you left, she took the Chimera and Peísma somewhere. Something about more monster friendly area's of town.”

“Well, I'm sure she can hold her own against any monsters. She is their mother after all.” Percy said, shrugging as he sat down next to Annabeth. “Besides, this is probably the first time she's done anything without my approval. And she can't do anything that could betray us you know.”

“Just wonderin'.” Grover said.

It was silent, save for the news. The weather around Manhattan was getting worse, and the sea's were following suit.

“Man, It looks like Zeus and Poseidon are getting ready for all out war already. They might not even last until the summer solstice.” Grover said.

“Oh, they will.” Percy said. “Or Zeus is going to lose the Master bolt.”

“You really wouldn't steal it now, would you Percy?” Grover asked.

“Nope. Though I had a nice little chat with it.”

“So now you can talk to inanimate objects? Grover deadpanned.

“Kinda. The Master bolt has a soul Grover. I talked to that. She's not very happy that Zeus didn't take care of her physical form.” Percy said.

Grover shook his head. “Of course it does. And it's female too.” He grumbled. “I swear, if I wake up as a girl I will make your life miserable.”

“Don't worry about it G. I wouldn't think about it.” Percy said.

Grover snorted. “Yeah. Well, I'm going to sleep. If you guys are going to have sex, try not to wake me up.” He said, laying back on his bed.

Annabeth blushed once again, glaring at Grover. Though she didn't move away from Percy.

Percy glanced at Annabeth. “Does he really think I'd turn him into a girl?” Percy asked.

“I think he's still adjusting to everything, and you have to admit that it is happening so fast.” She said. “So don't take him too seriously.”

Percy nodded slowly. “Yeah...” He said, looking up at the ceiling. His head hurt, and not from earlier that day. Actually, his whole body hurt. It was kind of a burning sensation, just under the skin, one that had nothing to do with Phosphora shocking him so much. It had started right after he and Melum had sex. Maybe he should talk to the book about it.

“Hey, Annabeth. Before I forget, can I borrow your hat?” Percy asked, calling the Eronomicon to his hand.

“Sure, but what for?” She asked.

“A gift for you, and I'll leave it at that.” He said, placing a hand on his head.

Annabeth nodded, getting up and rummaging through her bag. She pulled out the Yankees cap, tossing it to Percy. “There you go. I want it back in one piece, alright?”

Percy nodded. “I'll be back soon Annabeth. I gotta talk to the book about something.” He said, kissing her cheek. He vanished, heading off to Fates knew where.

~Chamber of Fate

Percy appeared in the chamber once again, the Fates not working their loom.

'Hello, Perseus.' Clotho said.

'Back so soon?' Lachesis asked.

'Is something the matter Percy?' Atropos asked, moving beside him. She placed a hand to his forehead. 'You're burning up!'

“Yeah, I know.” Percy said, panting. It was even hotter now, he was starting to sweat. “Look, I need you to come back into the book with me. I know it knows what's going on, and I have a feeling I might pass out any minute. I need you to work with it in case something happens to me.”

The Fates nodded. For something like this, they weren't going to mess around.

Percy took a big gulp of air. When did it get so dry? He held up the book, letting the Fates place their hands on it. “Pull us in.” He ordered.

The world faded to black.

When Percy came to, he wasn't burning much more then he already was. “Hey, Eronomicon! I think we have a problem here!” He said, standing up. Around him, the Fates were already standing.

“I would think so.” The tome said. “You have passed the limits of power your body can handle, which explains the burning sensation you are feeling. Though this isn't good in the slightest, since your immortality hasn't fully matured yet, it does give you a wonderful opportunity for one of my most powerful items.”

“Will it help control the power?” Percy asked. Right now, nothing mattered but making the burning sensation stop.

“Indeed it would, Marked one.”

“Give it to me then.” Percy said, almost falling to one side. The Fates kept him upright though. “Oh, I don't feel so good.”

In front of the group, a pair of gauntlets materialized on a table.

“Here, wear these. They should contain and control your power.”

Percy nodded, stumbling over to the table with the help of the Fates. He could feel his legs giving out, and there was a horrible strain on his body. Like he was about to literally explode.

Percy grabbed one of the Gauntlet's, slipping it onto his right hand. He felt a little better, that much was for certain. He grabbed the other, almost dropping it. Clotho helped him put it on, tightening the straps while Lachesis did the same to the other.

Instantly, Percy dropped to his knees. The power was building, the pain growing each second. It was being focused on his hands, which burned the worst. H could feel his bones starting to crack in his hands, starting to burn.

Finally, he let loose a loud scream. He roared to the heavens in pain, unleashing untold amounts of power as he did so. Even the Fates had to brace themselves on tables.

1552222222222222222112222121212122211221.content:
The entirety of the Eronomicon's dimension shook with pure power. Even the Chamber of Fate outside the Eronomicon shook with his power.

Percy didn't know how long he screamed, it was all a blur to him. One very painful blur.

When he could breath again, Percy took deep breaths. The burning sensation faded slowly, the burning in his hands healing.

Percy put his hands on the floor to push himself up.

Only to have them go clear through as if it wasn't even there.

“Whoa!” Percy said falling on his ass, pulling his hands out of the ground. Where he placed his hands, there was two perfect holes in the shape of his hands.

“Please be careful marked one.” The tome asked. “Those gauntlets you are wearing are some of the most powerful things I've come across. They are containing your power right now, amplifying it by an unprecedented amount. Your power is far beyond my capabilities of reading!”

“Okay, I think I need a better explanation then that.” Percy said, keeping his hands in the air and away from the ground.

“These gauntlets I have called the Alpha's armlets, Marked one. They not only possess astounding amounts of power by themselves, but also amplify the power of the one who wears them! They are the best example of pure power that I have ever seen. I found them not unlike the boots you wear, but they had no owner to have ever existed. They just were.”

“That explains the history, but what about them? There has to be more then that.” Percy said, trying to stand up without using his hands.

“You are correct, Marked one. Though my knowledge on them is limited, for several reasons, I know that they can steal or copy the abilities of any other glove or bangle like object. I have lost many other artifacts to these gauntlets due to this ability it carries, while others were merely rendered useless due to it copying their powers. And I can only really assume that they are incredibly powerful on their own, as the void was had pressed to even near them. It was a struggle, getting these, and for a good reason it would seem.”

“Okay, that's kinda scary. If these things can keep the void at bay, I wonder what else they can do.” Percy said, looking at them. The gauntlets were dark blue, almost black. They looked like they were made in the same style as medieval plate gauntlets, but almost reaching his elbow. He could still move his wrist easily enough though. They had viscous, jagged spikes coming from their knuckles, facing up if he let his arms hang. The fingers ended in claws, as viscous as the knuckle spikes. There were spines coming out from the sides, looking like the fins of a fish. Imbedded into the back of the hand were two eye-like gemstones, looking like the eyes of a natural predator.

“I am as intrigued at you are, Marked one.” The tome said. “Could you tell me if there are any changes to you? Are you feeling any different?”

Percy shook his head. “Not really. Though I really want to fight something.” Percy said. He then noticed that the Fates were looking very flushed. They were panting extremely heavily, so much so that if they were mortal Percy would have worried for their safety. “Girls, are you okay?” He asked, their eyes being very unfocused.

That couldn't have been a good thing.

'Perseus~'

'Please...'

'Need you Perseus...'

Percy could smell their arousal, watching as they reached for him.

“Uh oh.” Percy said, backing up. “Girls, I don't want to hurt you. You need to stay away right now, until I figure out how to control these things.” He said, backing up, keeping his hands as far from touching anything as possible.

The Fates weren't going to have it though. They advanced faster, proclaiming their need, stripping themselves of their dresses.

“Girls, now listen-” Percy started, feeling himself bump into a table. “Ah shit.” Percy said. He was about to use the boots to get far away, but Clotho lunged at him, not unlike an animal.

She latched onto his arm, tearing at his shirt in an effort to get him undressed.

Percy instinctively raised his hand, grabbing her arm.

Only for nothing to happen.

No cries of pain, not shattering of bones. No tears, no anything.

Well, that wasn't right.

Clotho moaned at his touch, more so then with the seal of the addicting limb activated.

“Interesting...” The Eronomicon trailed off.

“What? What's so interesting?” Percy said, trying to pull his hand away from Clotho, only for Lachesis to grab it and place it on her ass. Once again, nothing bad happened, only more moans of pure pleasure.

“It seems the gauntlets will not harm a woman. Otherwise, even the weavers would have been irreparably damaged. And it seems that the gauntlets are making them attracted to you, much like animal's during mating season. It is almost a physical need for them, I can see quite clearly. They have lost higher brain functions due to such a close proximity to you, and your touch only brings them pleasure. More pleasure then the seal of the Addicting limb would when combined with Casanova’s dance.” The tome said, and Percy could almost see it looking over them with a careful eye.

“Well, as much as I would love to have sex right now,” Percy said, trying to reclaim his hands and shirt while trying to keep hold of his pants. “I need to learn how to control these things. Do you know anywhere I could go to figure this out. You know, without hurting anyone or anything?”

“I do have a map of all universe's I have come across. Perhaps you would like to go to one of them? Somewhere you could train in the real world, so that you can learn to control these gauntlets? Your power alone can take you through the void now, but your boots and the gauntlets shall make it that much easier.”

“Do it. I'm going to leave them here,” He said, nodding towards the fates. “So you can explain what's happening.”

“Of course Marked one. They shall instruct the rest of your followers of your absence.” The Eronomicon said, making a map appear in Percy's hand.

In an instant, Percy was gone. The fates looked around for him, their heads clearing as their eyes refocused.

'Ugh.' Lachesis said, putting a hand to her head and rubbing her bare ass. 'What happened? Sisters?'

'I do not recall.' Atropos said, shaking her head as she tried to focus. 'I remember Percy coming in to our chambers, burning up.'

'After that, we came inside the book.' Clotho said, her arm feeling really tingly and nice for some reason. 'There was a scare... and some gauntlet's...'

'And after that is a blank?' The sister's asked each other at the same time.

“I would think that you would not remember.” The Eronomicon said, taking Annabeth's hat to use as the Marked one instructed it. “Losing all higher brain function tends to cause short term memory loss.”

'What happened?' Clotho asked. 'What happened to Perseus?'

'Yes, please tell us what has happened to our husband?' Lachesis asked, looking around.

'I-Is he...dead?' Atropos asked, for once afraid of that word. Dead. Death. Something that they would never have thought to fear, for themselves or for anyone else. Clotho and Lachesis looked as worried as she did.

“Do not fear. The Marked one is safe, Weaver's.” The book said, making all three sigh in relief. “However, he will be gone for some time. The gauntlets he now wears caused some... unexpected side-effects. He is going somewhere to learn how to control them, so as to not put anyone in danger. He has instructed me to inform you so that you could tell your fellow Harem members.”

The Fates nodded. They were just Glad Perseus wasn't dead. 'Trust us, book. We shall let them know.'

Percy appeared in the middle of the forest, next to a raging river. He didn't even know where he was exactly.

“Who dares near my river?” A male voice called.

“Oh great.” Percy said sarcastically. “Just what I need, a territorial river god.” He said, feeling very aggressive. How dare he try to command him! “Come on out you asshole! I ain't in the mood for this bullshit!”

The river raged harder, shuddering as something charged underneath the water's surface.

Then, with a mighty moo, a bull the size of a two-story house charged out, horns lowered and aimed right for Percy.

“I guess I was right on the bull part.” He said, a smirk on his face. What was wrong with him?

He reached out, holding his hand up as if to stop the horn from skewering him.

And it worked.

As the river god neared, Percy pulled his hand back, thrusting it into a horn. The horn shattered on impact, turning into something very much less then dust, less then atoms. It was almost as if the horn didn't exist anymore. The air even rippled, creating a vacuum where his hand met physical matter.

In a flash, Percy was standing on the raging river god who was being thrown back by the force of his blow. They were flying much farther then whatever forest Percy found himself in, flying at speeds that his boots were hard pressed to achieve, at least since he last checked their full power.

It was kind of hard to keep tabs on something that increased in power as you did, especially when you're growing in power by leaps and bounds.

Even his eyes were having a hard time telling where they were going, where they were and where they had already been.

Percy grabbed the bulls head, not even putting pressure on it, causing it to just kind of...

Cease existing.

There wasn't even a spray of Ichor to signify that he had caused such major damage. It was just there one minute, gone the next.

Percy felt as incredible power flowed through him. It wasn't as much as when he deflowered the Fates or Melum, and no where close to when he put on the gauntlets, but it was still power.

He could feel the river he had been at. He didn't know how he did, but he just did. He could see the entirety of it, every bend and turn, every waterfall, every pebble and fish in its full length. From where it started, a spring in the mountains, to the lake where the river ended.

He could see every Nymph along its shores, every nymph that was part of the river. He even felt his control over water increase, powerful as it had been already. He could see a family camping, using the river, his river, for white water rafting.

Percy didn't know when the god's dead body was going to stop. If it did, it was sure to cause damage. It was huge, heavy, and moving at speeds he didn't think were possible.

Percy grabbed the corpse, crushing it like it was wet paper. Well, no, that wasn't it. Wet paper at least put up some resistance, and it kept a physical form if you crumpled it up.

The bull's body just stopped existing. Either that, or it was crushed so small that it couldn't be seen by any microscope and was beyond being reconstructed.

Unfortunately, Percy started to randomly tumble. Nothing was there to stick his feet to.

“Ugh, I think I'm going to be sick.” Percy said, reaching out to grab something, anything.

And everything stopped moving.

“Ooph!” Percy said, his grip crushing whatever it was in his hand. He opened his eyes, suddenly glad he didn't have vertigo, or acrophobia or anything like that.

He was hanging in the middle of the sky.

Not connected to anything.

Just... hanging there.

Percy didn't know where he was. He was above another forest, though it was far from the river he now owned.

Percy looked at his hand. “What the crap?” He asked.

It was like... the sky... was being folded by his hand. Or was it the air? Did it matter?

He had wanted to grab anything.

Anything.

And he started getting an idea on what else the gauntlets could do.

Percy stayed there, hanging there.

“Oh man, I wish I could stand on air.” Percy said, hanging freely. “Would be the only safe place for me right now.”

And suddenly, he felt as if he was standing on solid ground.

“Don't tell me...” Percy said, stomping his feet on empty air.

“Well, damn.” Percy said. “I guess there's so much I don't know still.” He said, looking at the map in his free hand. “I'll be back Annabeth, Grover, Melum and everyone else. But I need more control.” He said, unfurling the map.

“Now, what would be a good place for training?”

~With Grover and Annabeth

Annabeth was watching the news when a sudden sonic boom blasted. She screamed, covering her ears as the glass on the window and the TV shattered, the building rumbling. Grover yelled, jolting awake, covering his ears.

“What in the world was that?!” Grover yelled, having a hard time hearing himself.

“I don't know!” Annabeth yelled back.

“Mistress! Are you alright?” Melum's voice called, being a little easier to hear then anything else.

“Mel?” Annabeth called back. “Are you and Medusa okay?”

“Yes Mistress! We're fine!”

“Bring Medusa to our room Mel! We need to stick together right now!” Annabeth yelled.

“Yes Mistress!” Mel called, falling silent.

A minute later, the door slammed open, Melum helping a disoriented Medusa walk.

“What happened?” She asked, rubbing her ear. It was getting easier to hear again.

“I don't know Medusa.” Annabeth said, her and Grover doing the same thing. They could hear the wails of sirens outside now, already a panic in the streets.

'I believe we could answer that.' A voice said in their heads, one that Annabeth and Melum knew.

“Clotho!” Annabeth said, turning around. “What happened? Did Percy have something to do with this?”

The buxom Fate nodded. 'Yes, he did. But this is not the time or place to speak of such things. All of you will be taken to our Weaving chamber. There, we can discuss what has happened while me and my sister's try to undo what has happened.'

Annabeth nodded, along with everyone else.

“I just want to say, for the record, that Percy is blessed by Nike.” Grover said, looking over the fate, and referring to the goddess of luck and victory. Hell, he knew that this was a fate standing before him, and he wasn't cowering in fear.

Clotho smiled at Grover. 'You would think so, but you would be wrong. He is a blessing unto us. But enough about that. We should get going.'

Then that familiar sensation of being teleported overtook them.

'We've finally finished fixing the mess that Percy caused.' Lachesis said, whipping sweat from her brow.

'Yes, though I doubt he meant for it to happen.' Atropos chimed in, popping her knuckles.

'I doubt he would either, but the fact of the matter still stands.' Clotho said, rubbing her eyes. 'Perseus owes us when he gets back from training.'

The other two fates nodded. They had to undo several weaving’s that had happened without their knowledge, due to Percy's actions, and had essentially rewound time. However, they couldn't add back one river god for some reason. They had worked in such a frenzy, trying to find and cut the weaving's of fate that had become frayed with the world wide destruction and chaos. They brought back those who had died due to this phenomena.

And they had to do all that while explaining what had transpired with Percy, the Eronomicon and the gauntlet's.

The women had been horrified, though Grover had been worried over his best friend as well. Not even Melum knew such a thing was possible, nor that the Great Tome had such a powerful item.

Everyone was relieved to know that Percy had recovered, though they had been saddened to hear that Percy would be a way for a while.

Melum kept the info of Time flowing differently in other universe's to herself for the moment.

After the fates sent them back to their repaired hotel, they being the only ones who would remember the devastation Percy caused in the entire world, Annabeth found her hat on her bed, note attached.

“Dear Annabeth, Medusa, And everyone else,” It began, making Annabeth call everyone over. “Sorry about what happened. I didn't know that the gauntlet's would do that. I know that I caused some pretty bad stuff, causing a world wide sonic boom like that. But trust me, that was one of the better things that could have happened. I won't say the best, but definitely not the worst. I could have punched the universe apart, so be glad that the sonic boom was the thing that happened.”

“He's got to be joking.” Grover said hopefully.

“Anyway, at the time of writing this, I've been training for a good while. Maybe a few months now, but I'm not sure. I know it's only been few days for you though. Believe it or not, I stopped by once or twice, maybe more. Figured out a new feature of the boots, after some trial and error, and a few psychotic breakdowns due to even more time travel (Don't ask). I was able to help myself grow stronger faster and learn control, both physical and mental, even quicker. And, I know what you're thinking, but no, I couldn't give this knowledge to the me from before the world shattering problem. Causes too many problems, and I might just explode if I did that.”

“Well, it certainly seems he thought that through.” Annabeth said, nodding. She was so proud of him for not destroying the time line.

Wow, that wasn't something you think on any day...

“I've been traveling for a while now. I've seen worlds that you might be able to believe, and some that would blow your mind out of the water. I want you to know that everything that you see on TV, everything you read, it happens. Out here, beyond any single universe, there are no boundaries. Everything happens, whether or not you think it's real. Melum should know, even if it's a small bit.”

Yes, I do.” Melum said, happy that her master was alright.

“Just so you know, I've been staying away from any of our universe's and anything that might be connected to them. Can't risk retroactively making them not exist in some stupid fashion, like looking at the sun wrong. That would be kind of a bad thing.”

Grover could only whimper in fear. He liked existing. And could entire universes end over something that trivial?

“Sorry, sorry. I shouldn't scare you. But it's a scary place out here, if you're not careful. There are really powerful beings out here. Not even half of them are gods either. There are humans, demons, monster's, aliens (Don't laugh) and all sorts of other things out here that could wipe the floor with Zeus, Kronos and even Gaea. It's not all bad though. There are some really relaxing universe's though. I won't go into details, since you wouldn't believe me anyway.”

“I wouldn't be too sure about that.” Medusa said, looking at Melum.

“Anyway, this is starting to get too long. I just wanted you to know that I'm fine. Annabeth, I had the Eronomicon do some fine tuning to your hat, allowing you to control when you go invisible. There's also a little extra something done to it for you, but don't worry. It won't be bad for anyone, trust me. Just don't let the power go to your head, please. Under the hat, I have some other things, even for Grover. G-man, I know you love nature and All, so I found/created/restored (Not sure which, time travel and all) something that will help amplify your nature magic, and help you learn to play better. It's a pan flute, so you should get the hang of it right away.”

Annabeth picked up her hat, and indeed there was a pan flute.

“Sweet.” Grover said, picking it up. “Thanks Percy, where ever you are right now.”

“Medusa, I figured out a way to copy the bracelet you have, so you can give one to your sister each, when they come back. And trust me, they will. Just keep believing in them, and they will. There should be two pieces of Paper with Identical seals, so just apply those to the bracelet and it'll work itself out. Look in your nightstand back in your room, and they'll be there for you.”

Medusa smiled, holding her arm. Her hand was still in a cast, since she couldn't take nectar or Ambrosia.

“Melum, I haven't gone to your original universe yet. I don't want to go there without you. I don't know what I'll find there, but I'm sure it'll be good to see your home, right? Anyway, I created something special for you. It's a voice regulator. I figured one reason you seemed to show such little emotion with such a beautiful voice was that you had to keep a tight reign on your emotions so you wouldn't do something you would regret. Well, you don't have to worry about that now. It'll be in your nightstand in your room. I want you to learn how to show emotion, and Know that you will always be needed and wanted.”

Melum smiled, feeling a few tears gather. He was right, in some fashion.

“Tell the Fates that I'm doing fine if you can talk to them. Well, scratch that, I know you will be able to do that Annabeth. I haven't found anything for them yet, but I'm trying. Love you girls, and a brotherly hug to you Grover.

Signed,
Perseus Jackson,
The Future Harem God


P.S. Oh, almost forgot. Don't be surprised if I come home with some new additions to the group. I had to save a few universe's on my journeys.

P.P.S. It's been almost a year since I left. Still missing you guys. Be back soon. More additions to the group.

P.P.P.S. Hi guys. Be back on the day of going to the underworld. And yes, I keep adding to this, since it has been at least the fifth time I've popped back home to this universe. Helps me remember where home is. Still love you all. I haven't forgotten the time we spent together Annabeth, so don't worry. Nor you Medusa, or Melum, or The Fates. It helps keep me going, knowing that I've got you all waiting for me. And don't worry. I'll be relaxing in some slower timed universe's, so it won't be several years for me when I get back. Maybe another week or so at most. You all relax as much as you can, but train as well.”

Annabeth put it down, tears on her eyes. “He's been gone so long.” She said, sitting down. “But it doesn't seem like he's been gone a day.”

Melum sat down next to her. “There, there Mistress. It will be alright. Master Perseus will be back soon..” She said, patting Annabeth's shoulder.

Annabeth sniffed. “I know, but still. It's been such a short time for us, but almost a year for him. I feel like I got ripped off in terms of sharing his life with him.” She said.

Medusa smiled though. “Hey, at least we know he loves us. You, goat boy. You're going to learn how to play those pipes for the next few days.”

“Well, okay... I planned on it anyway.” Grover said, looking over the pipes. “This is so finely crafted... Are those markings grown in? It's like these were made for this.”

“And I swear, if I hear Hilary Duff, or whatever you kids listen to now, I will turn you to stone until Percy comes back.” Medusa said, looking harshly at him. Not that he noticed, engrossed in looking at his new instrument.

“Mistress, why don't you put on the hat?” Melum asked, eager to see what her mistress had gotten from their master.

“Well, couldn't hurt...” Annabeth said, folding the letter and putting it in her pocket. She slipped on her Yankees cap expecting to turn invisible. She held up her hand, since she wasn't able to see herself when she wore it.

She could see her hand.

“Huh, would you look at that.” She said, not entirely surprised. “Looks like he did make it better.” She said, thinking to herself to turn invisible. Her hand faded, reappeared and vanished again as she thought of being either invisible or not. “Now what did Percy say about being able to contact the Fates?”
1552222222222222222112222121212122211221.title: Rewrite what was broken, and letters from beyond.

choices: Seventeen days later, when Percy returns
Percy comes back sooner, but it has been longer then a year for him.
1552222222222222222112222121212122211221.content:
'You wished to speak with us...Mistress?' Lachesis' voice suddenly sounded behind everyone.

Annabeth blinked. “Uh, are you talking to me?” She asked.

'Of course, Mistress. Who else could I be addressing?' Lachesis asked, her fiery eyes looking at Annabeth with respect.

Annabeth was silent, taking that in. 'Okay Annabeth, so You've got one of the Fates calling you Mistress, and most likely the others as well. Percy said not to let the power go to your head...' “Okay, yeah. Um, just wanted you to know that Percy sent us a note telling us he was fine. He'll be back on the day we go to the underworld. He also says he loves you and your sisters very much.”

Lachesis nodded. 'That's good. Me and my sisters were getting worried about our dear husband. How has his training gone?' She asked.

“He says, it has been going well, since he's been gone for about a year.” Annabeth said, looking down. “At least, that's what it's been for him.”

Lachesis nodded again, a smile growing on her face. 'Good, good. We wouldn't want dear Perseus to do something he would regret. I cannot wait to see him again, and I know my sisters can't either. I'll bet he's grown into such a fine young man during his time away.'

“It seems like it.” Annabeth said, nodding with a wistful smile on her face.

'Will that be all Mistress?' Lachesis asked.

“Hmm? Oh yeah, that's it.” Annabeth said.

Lachesis bowed, fading back to the Cambers of Fate.

Grover blinked, noticing what had happened. “Annabeth, did you just order one of the FATES around?”

“I think so, yes.” Annabeth said, thinking on that. “Melum, do you know why I would be able to do that?”

“Yes Mistress.” Melum said with a smile. “It would be the Empresses Crown. Master Perseus must have imbued your hat with it's power. It declares you as first Mistress to all followers of Master Perseus. Even now, I can feel the authority given to you by the Crown. You can too, can't you Medusa.” She said, looking at the dark skinned beauty.

She nodded, if grudgingly. “Yeah, I guess I can. It's a need to follow your orders, and call you Mistress, that much I can tell. And it's not even forcing me to listen to you. For some reason, I WANT to listen to you.” She said.

Annabeth nodded. “Okay, that's weird. But I'm honored that Percy would give me this power, this authority. I promise to try not to abuse it.”

But Melum's eyes twinkled. “Don't make promises you cannot Keep, Mistress. Just a word of advice. Besides, it is your power to abuse. Unless Master Perseus says otherwise, you are free to command us.” She said, tone being Mirthful. She was happy that there was an official mistress now.

Annabeth nodded slowly. “Well, okay... But Percy did say to not let the power go to my head.” She said, a small laugh coming from her. “He knows me too well. That kelp head.” She shook her head with a smile.

It was silent for a while, no one knowing what to do.

“Annabeth, what should we do now? We have a little more then two weeks until Percy comes back.” Grover asked, looking at the blond haired strategist.

“Well, Percy did say we should train, but relax as well. And that's what we'll do.” She said. “Grover, I want you to learn how to play those pipes. Learn songs that don't make the ground try and strangle you, please.” She said, making him look away in embarrassment.

“I'll work on perfecting my stare.” Medusa chimed in. “I can petrify people easily, but it's a little tough to return them to normal. But at least I can do that now.” She said.

“What should I do Mistress?” Melum asked, her voice still soft. Percy's gift would help that though.

“Melum, I want you to try and find Echidna.” Annabeth said. “I don't know where she went, but I want her found. Tell her that I want her to report back here every 24 hours, no ifs and/or buts about it. You're the only one here strong enough to deal with her and wherever she may be. I want you to go in ready for a fight. I don't know how monsters will act around her, nor how many there could be since we're so close to the underworld.”

Melum nodded. “As you wish it, Mistress.” She said, getting up to leave.

“Not now Mel.” Annabeth said, stopping her. “I want everyone to get a good nights sleep and some decent food first.”

What little food the Fates could conjure up as they worked wasn't tasty, filling or nutritional. It was more along the lines of something to tide them over until real food was available.

Melum nodded.

Annabeth was about to continue, when she noticed something hanging on the bill of her hat. She pulled it down, seeing that it was another note.

“P.P.P.P.S. Almost forgot. Annabeth, I want you to research any and all myths from every culture. Primarily Egyptian. I'm pretty sure you know the roman 'myths' well enough, right?” She read, putting down the note. “Well, it seems I know what I'm going to be doing.” Annabeth said. “Now everyone get a good night's rest. We got a lot to do.” She said, making everyone nod.
1552222222222222222112222121212122211221.title: The Mistress has been marked! Tasks set by the god

choices: Percy summones some crowd control to do it for him...
1552222222222222222112222121212122211221.content:
The entire group was standing outside of the DOA studios, waiting for Percy.

“Will you stop glaring at me like that?” Echidna asked, sighing. “I only did what I could to try and give Dear Percy an army.”

“By offering them souls?” Annabeth accused, glaring. She was back in her old body, from before she had been brought back in time. Though she thought her chest was a little bigger, not that she was complaining mind you.

Echidna looked aghast, even offended. “I only looked for the more unruly souls to let my children feast on. I don't know about you, but I know for a fact that Percy has changed. Very rapidly I might add. My dear, sweet daughter,” She said, stroking the Chimera's mane. The humanoid monster had a dull look in her eyes, almost unnaturally so. “Has had quite a few episode's, dealing with Percy's emotions controlling hers. That is more then enough to tell me that Percy has done some things that would make you sick to your stomach.”

“Still, those are human souls. They won't get the fair judgment that they should now.” Annabeth said.

“Are you saying that those who do wrong deserve to burn in the fields of punishment?” Echidna asked, looking at Annabeth with accusations of her own. “My way they wouldn't suffer for very long. And they couldn't try and escape, like that Sisyphus man did several times.”

Annabeth tried to resist shouting at the mother of monsters. Even in her position as Mistress of Percy's Harem, something she had gotten accustomed to for the past two weeks, the woman was insufferable! She took every chance she could to try and work around Annabeth's rules, looking for every loophole.

It made Annabeth question if she was the mother of Lawyers as well.

Everyone knew they were monsters anyway.

“What's this about sacrificing souls now?” A semi-familiar voice sounded in the shadows.

Everyone spun around, weapons drawn.

“Alpha.” The Chimera said, voice sounding bland and emotionless. She merely turned, looking at where the voice had come from. Her blank eyes seemed to regain a little luster to them.

A tall, imposing figure walked out of the shadows. He was almost seven feet tall, with wild black hair. He was wearing a black tank top, showing off his tanned skin and athletic physique. He wore blue swimming trunks, though a ballpoint pen was sticking out of one pocket, and a pocket book from another. He wore running shoes, really comfortable ones as well. He also wore fingerless gloves, small spikes attached to the knuckles and eyes stitched into the back, watching them all with an unnatural hunger. On one of his fingers was a ring, similar to the one the Chimera wore.

But it was his eyes. Annabeth could never mistake those eyes. They glowed in the dark, a deep sea-green.

“Percy?” Annabeth asked, lowering her weapon.

The figure laughed, with such great joy that it was startling. “Of course it's me...” He said, walking slowly towards her. The way he carried himself spoke much for him. He walked with a purpose, but also with a spring in his step, as if something amazing had happened to him. Standing in front of Annabeth, he raised his hand, touching her cheek softly, as if it were an illusion to him. “My queen.” He said, leaning down to capture her in a kiss.

Annabeth didn't feel anger, as she had when unsavory types looked at her during her stay in Hollywood. In fact, she melted into the kiss, instinctively wrapping her arms around the taller figure's shoulders.

Grover coughed, making both pull apart.

“What's the matter Grover?” Percy asked, looking at his friend. “Don't like public displays of affection?” He laughed, a strong, hearty laugh. “Ah, come over here you fuzzy bastard. It's good to see ya.” He said, opening his arms to give the Satyr a hug as well.

“No, that's okay...” Grover said, backing away. “If you don't mind, I don't want to be near the universe cracking hands.”

Percy shrugged. “Fine, have it your way. It's not like I trained to make sure that I didn't crack the universe for almost a year, but whatever.” He said. He turned to look at the rest of the group. “Medusa, Melum. How are you two?”

“Just peachy, Percy.” Medusa said, smiling at him as she got an eyeful. She was pleased with what she saw, very pleased. She couldn't help but lick her lips.

“Better then ever Master.” Melum said, smiling widely at Percy, her tone incredibly joyful. Around her neck, there was Percy's gift to her. It was a diamond necklace, with a perfectly cut sapphire in the middle. When she found it, there had been a note that read 'Still not as perfect as your eyes, but it was the closest I could get.' In the last two weeks, she had been getting used to the new heights her emotions could reach without making everyone else feel what she did. It was nice, not having to be nearly as careful with her emotions.

Percy nodded, smiling at them just as much as Annabeth. “That's good. Did you enjoy my gifts?” He asked, getting happy nods from them. He held out his hand, as if gripping a staff or pole. “Here's a little something for you Medusa.” He said, a staff suddenly appearing in his hand. It was like any other, for the most part. Made of oak wood, about five feet in length. The only difference was that it had the head of a snake on top, carved out of wood. He gently tossed the staff at her. “Should allow you some control over snakes. Figured you would like something like that. And, as a bonus, it can shoot venom. Should allow you some extra combat potential.” He explained as she caught it.

She looked it over, admiring the work. “Very nice, you charmer you.” She said, placing the end on the ground. She noticed a small note in the mouth. She took it out, reading the small piece of paper silently. 'It's also good for hypnotizing people, F.Y.I.'

Percy looked at Echidna, his face darkening. “What's this I hear about sacrificing souls?” He asked, eyes smoldering in already growing anger.

“It's not what you think Percy.” Echidna said, starting to sweat. He was mad at her, dangerously so. It didn't take her being connected to him to know that. “They were horrible people. Rapists, thieves and other criminals! I made sure of it before letting my children attack them.”

Percy continued to glare at her, but he said nothing. He merely narrowed his eyes slightly, making her squirm under his gaze, until he turned to the Chimera. He looked down at her eyes, seeing as they returned to some semblance of intelligence.

He put his hands on her shoulders, looking directly into her eyes. “I'm sorry for putting you through that.” He said, pulling her into a hug. “I never took the ring off. You must have had a very hard time, dealing with a years worth of emotions in a few days. Especially with all the shit I put myself through.” He said, stroking her mane.

The Chimera wrapped her arms around her Alpha. She could tell he was sad, very very sad at what he did to her. “It okay Alpha. You did not mean too.” She said. Her lessons weren't going so well in the language department, considering that she was mostly away from someone who could teach her. Well, someone that thought it would be important.

“No, it's really not.” Percy said, looking down at her again. “But I'll try to make it up to you, somehow.”

Still holding the Chimera, Percy looked at Peísma. “And you?” He asked.

“Fine.” She said simply, cowed by his mere presence. Yes, he was now a true Alpha for her.

“Good.” He replied, simple as her. “I gotta say, it's good to see you all again.” Percy said, letting go of the Chimera. “I tell ya, it has been an eventful year for me. What about you guys? Did you train well?”

Annabeth nodded. “Yeah, we all did.”

“Great.” Percy said. “But did you remember to relax as well?” He asked.

“This tan didn't happen by itself.” Annabeth said, motioning to her skin. It was true, she had put on a nice tan. The other girls as well, those that could tan anyway.

Percy nodded. “Good, good. Now, I'll be back in a few minutes. Going to go pick up my cousins from camp. I think it's time they met their father.” He said, vanishing.

~Camp half-blood

Percy appeared in the big house again. He looked around, taking in the features. “Man, it has been a while since I've been here.” He said, looking around. “Hey Seymour, how's it going?” He asked the animated mounted leopards head. It growled at him, though Percy could understand it. “Sorry Dionysus hasn't been around. Would you like me to give him a message when I see him next?”

The leopard made other noises, making Percy nod. “Okay, I'll tell him if I see him.” He said, patting the poor animal.

Percy walked out, walking through the halls of the Big House. “Chiron! Are you Here!” Percy called. He didn't hear a reply, nor any trotting or wheelchair's rolling across the floor. He made his way to the Front doors, walking outside.

The Camp was at the brink of war.

Hell, it almost looked like they were in the middle of one.

Several cabins were on fire, while the Hephaestus cabin and Forge were working overtime. The sounds of wounded came from Apollo cabin, and several Ares campers were guarding the Apollo, Aphrodite and Poseidon cabins, as well as the Demeter cabin.

In the distance, he could hear a battle raging.

Honestly, Percy was expecting more people to be against Poseidon.

“Alright, that's enough.” Percy said. He wasn't going to let a petty squabble like this tear the camp apart.
